title: Bitcoin Fog crypto mixer founder guilty of money laundering, jury finds
description:
Roman Sterlingov is the latest to fall to a U.S. government crackdown on illicit crypto-mixing services, but his lawyers aren’t taking the verdict lying down.

The founder of Bitcoin Fog, a massive $400 million crypto-mixing service, was convicted of money laundering in a United States District Court on Tuesday, March 12 — the latest win in the government’s crackdown on crypto mixers and their founders. 

Roman Sterlingov, 35, was found guilty of money laundering, money laundering conspiracy, operating an unlicensed money-transmitting business, and violations of the D.C. Money Transmitters Act.

Sterlingov, however, had argued throughout the trial that he was only a user of the service, and not its operator. His attorney, Tok Ekeland said in a March 12 X post that his team will appeal the verdict. 

Read more

title: Coinbase looks to raise $1 billion via bond offering amid bullish market trend
description:
Coinbase announced plans to launch a $1 billion bond offering to raise funds for its growth and expansion, according to a March 12 filing. The bonds, designated as unsecured convertible senior notes, are set to mature in 2030, offering investors the option to convert their holdings into Coinbase shares or cash at that time. The […]

title: Mysterious Chainlink ($LINK) Whales Start Amassing Tokens Amid Wider Market Rally
description: Signs of renewed interest are emerging for the decentralized oracle platform Chainlink ($LINK), as blockchain data shows a wave of deep-pocketed investors, colloquially known as whales, have been accumulating significant amounts of LINK.
